org.apache.ignite.hadoop.fs

Class IgniteHadoopIgfsSecondaryFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ignite.hadoop.fs.IgniteHadoopIgfsSecondaryFileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IgfsSecondaryFileSystem, org.apache.ignite.internal.processors.hadoop.HadoopPayloadAware, LifecycleAware

    public class IgniteHadoopIgfsSecondaryFileSystem
extends Object
implements IgfsSecondaryFileSystem, LifecycleAware, org.apache.ignite.internal.processors.hadoop.HadoopPayloadAware
    Secondary file system which delegates calls to an instance of Hadoop FileSystem.

    Target FileSystem's are created on per-user basis using passed HadoopFileSystemFactory.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultUserName

        @Nullable
public String getDefaultUserName()
        Gets default user name.

        Defines user name which will be used during file system invocation in case no user name is defined explicitly through FileSystem.get(URI, Configuration, String).

        Also this name will be used if you manipulate IgniteFileSystem directly and do not set user name explicitly using IgfsUserContext.doAs(String, IgniteOutClosure) or IgfsUserContext.doAs(String, Callable) methods.

        If not set value of system property "user.name" will be used. If this property is not set either, "anonymous" will be used.

        Returns:
        Default user name.

      • setDefaultUserName

        public void setDefaultUserName(@Nullable
                      String dfltUsrName)
        Sets default user name. See getDefaultUserName() for details.
        Parameters:
        dfltUsrName - Default user name.

      • getFileSystemFactory

        public HadoopFileSystemFactory getFileSystemFactory()
        Gets secondary file system factory.

        This factory will be used whenever a call to a target FileSystem is required.

        If not set, CachingHadoopFileSystemFactory will be used.

        Returns:
        Secondary file system factory.

      • setFileSystemFactory

        public void setFileSystemFactory(HadoopFileSystemFactory factory)
        Sets secondary file system factory. See getFileSystemFactory() for details.
        Parameters:
        factory - Secondary file system factory.

      • update

        @Nullable
public IgfsFile update(IgfsPath path,
                       Map<String,String> props)
        Updates file information for the specified path. Existent properties, not listed in the passed collection, will not be affected. Other properties will be added or overwritten. Passed properties with null values will be removed from the stored properties or ignored if they don't exist in the file info.

        When working in DUAL_SYNC or DUAL_ASYNC modes only the following properties will be propagated to the secondary file system:

        • usrName - file owner name;
        • grpName - file owner group;
        • permission - Unix-style string representing file permissions.
        Specified by:
        update in interface IgfsSecondaryFileSystem
        Parameters:
        path - File path to set properties for.
        props - Properties to update.
        Returns:
        File information for specified path or null if such path does not exist.

      • rename

        public void rename(IgfsPath src,
          IgfsPath dest)
        Renames/moves a file.

        You are free to rename/move data files as you wish, but directories can be only renamed. You cannot move the directory between different parent directories.

        Examples:

        • "/work/file.txt" => "/home/project/Presentation Scenario.txt"
        • "/work" => "/work-2012.bkp"
        • "/work" => "/backups/work" - such operation is restricted for directories.
        Specified by:
        rename in interface IgfsSecondaryFileSystem
        Parameters:
        src - Source file path to rename.
        dest - Destination file path. If destination path is a directory, then source file will be placed into destination directory with original name.
